page.title: 11ABERDYFI CHILDHOOD cont.
page.content: Children were called to school by a large bell which could be heard all over the village.They had to be in the playground before the bell stopped. Three age groups were taught in the same classroom at the same time.There was no heating other than a large coal fire.This was surrounded by a massive fireguard and on a cold day five children at a time were allowed to warm their hands by the fire. Every morning all the children gathered in the hall and were tested on their tables.A correct answer meant they could go out to play. A childrens' policeman visited homes to check on children absent from school.The accepted punishment for naughty children was the cane. { Bramford Primary School would like {to place on record their thanks to Mr. {Lewis for his interest in their work.
